body.p: Which one of the following best describes Moore's law?

multiple_choice.choice: The number of transistors produced worldwide doubles every 18 to 24 months.
Transistors approximately double in cost every 18 to 24 months.
The number of transistors that can fit on an area of chip doubles every 18 to 24 months.
The speed of a transistor in gigahertz doubles every 18 to 24 months.

response.feedback: Moore's law involves a different sort of doubling.
Moore's law is not about increasing cost.
Moore's law is about fitting more transistors on a chip.
Increasing speed is only loosely associated with Moore's law.
